channel.title: Hacking, Red Teaming & malware development on 0x0ff537
channel.description: Recent content in Hacking, Red Teaming & malware development on 0x0ff537

item.title: DLL proxying & sideloading
item.description: While studying DLL injection techniques, specifically DLL sideloading, I found this article by Palo Alto Network’s Unit 42 When Pentest Tools Go Brutal: Red-Teaming Tool Being Abused by Malicious Actors. The article describes how the dropper was using using a technique known as DLL search order hijacking to sideload a malicious crafted DLL that will inject a Brute Ratel agent (badger) into a remote process’s memory space, in this case RuntimeBroker.

item.title: About me
item.description: Ethical hacker, musician, sound engineer, web developer and passionate about cybersecurity. I have been interested in hacking since late 90’s. I have always felt curious about how hackers do what they do, that curiosity turned into a hobby and the hobby turned into a passion! My first approach to this magnificent world was reverse engineering some malware, and now a days I like to code it. I’m also a junior full-stack web developer, this has helped me understand how things work behind the scenes in website hacking.
